original: sems can thams cad la dmigs shing byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gus par byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dmigs shing byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gus par byas te /
translated: It is to be focused on all sentient beings and to be a respectful mind endowed with loving kindness.🔽

original: dul bas sbyin pa byin pa de thams cad ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: dul bas sbyin pa byin pa de thams cad ni yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: All the giving that is done with a mind that is focused on all sentient beings, with a mind that is full of love, with a mind that is respectful, and with a mind that is disciplined is pure.

original: thar par bsngos te sbyin pa byin pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thar par bsngos te sbyin pa byin pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving that is dedicated to liberation is called “pure.”

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa bla na med par lta ba lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa bla na med par lta ba lnga ste /
translated: “Furthermore, there are five ways of regarding giving as unsurpassed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: Giving to the Tathāgata is unsurpassed.

original: dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: Giving to the Saṅgha is unsurpassed.

original: chos smra ba la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos smra ba la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: Giving to Dharma teachers is unsurpassed.

original: nad pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: nad pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: Giving to the sick is unsurpassed.

original: pha ma la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: pha ma la sbyin pa byin pa ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: Giving to one’s mother and father is unsurpassed.”

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa chen por 'gyur ba ni rgyal po rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug las nyams pa la sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa @462a *//🔽chen po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa chen por 'gyur ba ni rgyal po rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug las nyams pa la sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa @462a *// chen po yin no //
translated: Moreover, a gift becomes a great gift when it is given to a king who has fallen from the sovereignty of a kingdom.

original: rgyal pos mnar ba dang / mgon med pa dang / nad pa la sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: rgyal pos mnar ba dang / mgon med pa dang / nad pa la sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: A gift becomes a great gift when it is given to a king who is tormented, to a helpless person, or to a sick person.

original: rgyal pos spangs nas gzhan na yang nyam nga zhing srog chad la khad pa 'chi la thug pa las gsos na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: rgyal pos spangs nas gzhan na yang nyam nga zhing srog chad la khad pa 'chi la thug pa las gsos na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: A gift becomes a great gift when it is given to someone who is abandoned by the king, who is in a foreign land, who is in distress, and who is on the verge of death.

original: na ba la sman byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: na ba la sman byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: A gift becomes a great gift when medicine is given to the sick.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la dus su sbyin pa byin na 'bras bu chen po yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la dus su sbyin pa byin na 'bras bu chen po yin no //
translated: A gift becomes a great gift when it is given to the community of noble ones who are perfect in morality, and when it is given at the right time.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba phun sum tshogs pa la sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: giving to those who are endowed with wisdom, giving to those who are endowed with liberation, and giving to those who are endowed with the insight of liberated wisdom is a great giving.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / ri dvags la sogs pa la mi 'jigs pa byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / ri dvags la sogs pa la mi 'jigs pa byin na sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: Giving fearlessness to those who have gone to the animal realm, to crows, owls, deer, and so on, is a great giving.

original: gang la gang dgos pa dang / mi bdog pa de'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni sbyin pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: gang la gang dgos pa dang / mi bdog pa de'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni sbyin pa chen po yin te /
translated: Fulfilling the wishes of those who need something, even if you have nothing, is a great giving.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: de ltar na sbyin pa byin pa yongs su dag pa dang / sbyin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa byin pa yongs su dag pa dang / sbyin pa chen po yin no //
translated: thus giving is pure and great.

original: sbyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di dag 'dod pas de ltar sbyin pa yongs su dag par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di dag 'dod pas de ltar sbyin pa yongs su dag par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire these pure gifts should cultivate pure giving in this way.

original: sems can gang dag gzhan dag gis da ltar bskul nas dad pa dang / dang ba bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gzhan dag gis da ltar bskul nas dad pa dang / dang ba bskyed de /
translated: Those sentient beings who, having been urged by others, give rise to faith and confidence

original: sbyin pa yongs su dag pa @462b 'di la rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ba de dag mtshungs par bsod nams skyed pa po dang / sbyin bdag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa yongs su dag pa @462b 'di la rjes su yi rang bar 'gyur ba de dag mtshungs par bsod nams skyed pa po dang / sbyin bdag tu 'gyur te /
translated: and rejoice in this pure generosity will be equal in the generation of merit and will become benefactors.

original: de ltar na gang rjes su yid rang ba dang / gang bskul ba de dag thams cad bsod nams skyed pa por mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gang rjes su yid rang ba dang / gang bskul ba de dag thams cad bsod nams skyed pa por mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all those who rejoice and those who are urged will be equal in the generation of merit.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: you asked, “When the Blessed Buddha has passed into parinirvāṇa, how will the ripening of merit occur?

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i bsod nams zad par 'gyur zhes khyod kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i bsod nams zad par 'gyur zhes khyod kyis smras pa /
translated: How will the merit of generosity be exhausted?”

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas bshad do //
translated: therefore, listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: gang la la zhig bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / da ltar bzhugs pa la mchod pa byed pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni mtshungs mnyam zhing 'dra'o zhes nga 'chad do //
analyzed: gang la la zhig bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / da ltar bzhugs pa la mchod pa byed pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni mtshungs mnyam zhing 'dra'o zhes nga 'chad do //
translated: I declare that the maturation of the merit of anyone who makes offerings to the Tathāgata, whether he is living or has entered parinirvāṇa, is the same.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gzugs chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni gzugs chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: The Tathāgatas are distinguished by the Dharma body,

original: chos gzugs kyi skus rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gzugs kyi skus rab tu phye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not by the form body.

original: gang la la zhig nga 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: gang la la zhig nga 'dug pa'am /
translated: If someone makes offerings to me when I am present,

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la mchod na sems mtshungs pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la bsod nams kyi khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la mchod na sems mtshungs pa'i phyir 'di gnyis la bsod nams kyi khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
translated: or if someone makes offerings to me when I have entered parinirvāṇa, there is no difference in the merit of these two, because their minds are the same.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Seer,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos ris su gtogs pa rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: dper na / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos ris su gtogs pa rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: For example, a wheel-turning king issues a decree to his realm:

original: nga'i gang gis kyang deng phyin chad srog gcod pa dang / @463a *//
analyzed: nga'i gang gis kyang deng phyin chad srog gcod pa dang / @463a *//
translated: “From now on, no one should kill living beings,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun gyi tshig 'byin pa dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa 'byin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang / rdzun gyi tshig 'byin pa dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa 'byin par mi bya'o //
translated: “Do not steal, do not engage in sexual misconduct, do not tell lies, do not slander, do not speak harshly, and do not engage in idle talk.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bsgo la /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bsgo la /
translated: “Do not arouse thoughts of covetousness, ill will, or wrong views.”

original: de la mi la las rgyal pos bsgo ba de thos nas bsgo ba rnams rjes su bsrungs na; rgyal po de'i lus la mchod pa byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la mi la las rgyal pos bsgo ba de thos nas bsgo ba rnams rjes su bsrungs na; rgyal po de'i lus la mchod pa byed pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: “Some people, having heard the king’s proclamation, will follow the proclamation and protect it.

original: rgyal po ngas bsgo ba bzhin du de dag gis kyang byas so snyam ste dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po ngas bsgo ba bzhin du de dag gis kyang byas so snyam ste dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will think, ‘The king has done this for us.’ They will be happy.

original: de dag rgyal po des bstan cing bsgo ba rab tu bsrung zhing srog gcod pa la sogs pa kun bsrung ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rgyal po des bstan cing bsgo ba rab tu bsrung zhing srog gcod pa la sogs pa kun bsrung ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Those who protect the king’s teachings and proclamations and protect life will, due to the ripening of that karma, be reborn in the higher realms.

original: gang dag rgyal po des bstan cing bsgo ba mi bsrung zhing /
analyzed: gang dag rgyal po des bstan cing bsgo ba mi bsrung zhing /
translated: Those who do not protect the teachings and edicts of that king,

original: mi dge ba'i las la sbyor ba de dag mi dge ba'i las byed pas tshe 'di la rgyal po de las sdug bsngal rjes su 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las la sbyor ba de dag mi dge ba'i las byed pas tshe 'di la rgyal po de las sdug bsngal rjes su 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: and who engage in non-virtuous actions, will experience suffering in this life due to their non-virtuous actions.

original: de 'di nas shi ba'i dus byas nas kyang log par ltung bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di nas shi ba'i dus byas nas kyang log par ltung bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even after they die, they will go to the lower realms.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: de bzhin du gang dag gis nga la gzugs kyi skur mthong la bslab pa rnams rjes su mi bsrung ba de dag gis ci 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag gis nga la gzugs kyi skur mthong la bslab pa rnams rjes su mi bsrung ba de dag gis ci 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: in the same way, what will those who see me as a form body but do not protect the trainings attain?

original: de dag gis log par lta ba bskyed nas lhas byin bzhin du sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis log par lta ba bskyed nas lhas byin bzhin du sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having generated wrong views, they will go to the hells like Devadatta.

original: @463b gang dag nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bslab pa rnams bsrung ba dang / mchod pa yang byed par 'gyur ba de dag ni ngas mchog dam par shes so //
analyzed: @463b gang dag nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bslab pa rnams bsrung ba dang / mchod pa yang byed par 'gyur ba de dag ni ngas mchog dam par shes so //
translated: Those who protect the trainings and make offerings when I have passed into parinirvāṇa, I recognize as the highest.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: de ltar nga mchog tu phyin te sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags shing /
analyzed: de ltar nga mchog tu phyin te sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags shing /
translated: In this way, I will have gone to the highest point, and will be superior to all sentient beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pas ma nges pa'i sems can rnams la ming bsgrags pas kyang bslab pa phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pas ma nges pa'i sems can rnams la ming bsgrags pas kyang bslab pa phun sum tshogs par bya'o //
translated: Having attained omniscient wisdom, I will also make all sentient beings who are not certain [to attain buddhahood] train perfectly by proclaiming my name.

original: drang srong chen po /🔽gang la la zhig nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: drang srong chen po / gang la la zhig nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: Great Sage,🔽anyone who makes offerings to me after I have passed into parinirvāṇa

original: 'das pa'i 'og tu mchod pa byed pa de nga 'dug pa la mchod pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'og tu mchod pa byed pa de nga 'dug pa la mchod pa bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: will be the same as making offerings to me while I am present.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: sems can de dag bsod nams lhag par bya ba gang byed pa thams cad ni bsod nams chen po'i 'phen pa byang chub tu 'gyur bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dag bsod nams lhag par bya ba gang byed pa thams cad ni bsod nams chen po'i 'phen pa byang chub tu 'gyur bar byas pa yin no //
translated: all the merit that those sentient beings create for the sake of surpassing merit will be directed towards great merit and enlightenment.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / chu ngogs kyi 'dam bu stug po'i nang du me btang na char pa'i rgyun 'bab pa'i chus de zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / chu ngogs kyi 'dam bu stug po'i nang du me btang na char pa'i rgyun 'bab pa'i chus de zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for example, if a fire is set in a thick reed swamp, the rain falling from the clouds will extinguish it.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: de bzhin du sbyin bdag sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po sdud par 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin pa'i tshogs de yang sbyin pa po nyid kyi rgyud la dad pa'i char pa bab na sbyin pa po nyid kyi rgyud la gsog par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin bdag sbyin pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po sdud par 'gyur ro // sbyin pa'i tshogs de yang sbyin pa po nyid kyi rgyud la dad pa'i char pa bab na sbyin pa po nyid kyi rgyud la gsog par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, the benefactor will gather a great heap of merit from generosity.🔽And that heap of generosity will be stored in the mindstream of the giver if the rain of faith falls on it.

original: sbyin pa byin pa de yang phung por gnas pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa de yang phung por gnas pa'am /
translated: But that generosity that is given will not be stored in the form of a heap,

original: spungs par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: spungs par gnas pa'am /
translated: or in the form of a pile,

original: phyogs na gnas pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or in a place.

original: @464a *// gang yang 'di ltar sbyin pa byin pa de'i byin pa de ni sbyin pa po de la grib ma bzhin du rjes su 'brang par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @464a *// gang yang 'di ltar sbyin pa byin pa de'i byin pa de ni sbyin pa po de la grib ma bzhin du rjes su 'brang par 'gyur te /
translated: And that generosity that is given will follow that giver like a shadow.

original: de nas sbyin pa po des bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa de mthong yang bsod nams de khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: de nas sbyin pa po des bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa de mthong yang bsod nams de khong du mi chud do //
translated: Then, although the giver sees that ripening of merit, he will not understand that merit.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / rgun rlon dang / bu ram shing ma btsir ba de la khu ba mi dmigs kyi /
analyzed: dper na / rgun rlon dang / bu ram shing ma btsir ba de la khu ba mi dmigs kyi /
translated: for example, the juice is not perceived in a fresh grape or sugarcane that has not been pressed,

original: btsir nas dmigs te rgun 'bru dang / bu ram shing de'i khu ba de yang phung por gnas pa'am /
analyzed: btsir nas dmigs te rgun 'bru dang / bu ram shing de'i khu ba de yang phung por gnas pa'am /
translated: When you squeeze them, you can see the juice of the grapes and sugarcane, but it does not exist as a mass,🔽or as a heap,

original: spungs par gnas pa'am /🔽phyogs na gnas par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: spungs par gnas pa'am / phyogs na gnas par mi snang ngo //
translated: or as a collection.

original: khu ba de ni rgun 'bru re re dang / bu ram shing gi dum bu re re'i nang du 'dus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khu ba de ni rgun 'bru re re dang / bu ram shing gi dum bu re re'i nang du 'dus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That juice is not contained in each individual grape or piece of sugarcane.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Seer,

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa byin pa de yang sbyin pa po'i lag pa'i rtse mo dang / snying dang / brang la rnam par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa byin pa de yang sbyin pa po'i lag pa'i rtse mo dang / snying dang / brang la rnam par mi gnas te /
translated: in the same way, that generosity is not located in the tip of the giver’s fingers, in his heart, or in his chest.

original: sbyin pa de rnam par smin pa mi 'byin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa de rnam par smin pa mi 'byin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: But that generosity does not fail to produce a result.

original: sbyin bdag 'dor ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag 'dor ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And the giver is not abandoned.

original: ji ltar rgun 'bru dang / bu ram shing bor na khu ba de dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du sbyin bdag med na sbyin pa'i rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgun 'bru dang / bu ram shing bor na khu ba de dmigs par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du sbyin bdag med na sbyin pa'i rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as when the grapes and sugarcane are discarded, the juice is no longer perceived, in the same way, when the giver is no longer present, the result of the generosity is no longer perceived.

original: tshe'i 'du byed ma btang bar yang sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed ma btang bar yang sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The ripening of generosity is not seen without the formation of life.

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon kha ma bus par shin tu snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon kha ma bus par shin tu snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, the seed of a banyan tree does not grow well without being planted.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa 'phel ba las 'bras bu grung por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa 'phel ba las 'bras bu grung por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, from the increase of generosity, the fruit becomes ripe.

original: drang @464b srong chen po /
analyzed: drang @464b srong chen po /
translated: Great Sage,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / tshong pa la la zhig rdzas kyi tshogs nyung ngu zhig khyer te /
analyzed: dper na / tshong pa la la zhig rdzas kyi tshogs nyung ngu zhig khyer te /
translated: For example, a certain merchant, having taken a small amount of goods,

original: yul gzhan gyi grong khyer du song nas /🔽tshong 'dus khyad par can du rang gi rdzas nor chen po rgyas par bsgyur te /
analyzed: yul gzhan gyi grong khyer du song nas / tshong 'dus khyad par can du rang gi rdzas nor chen po rgyas par bsgyur te /

original: drang srong chen po /

translated: “Great Sage,

translated: in the same way, when the consciousness of a being who has created merit dies and transmigrates from here, it thinks,

original: lus 'dis bdag ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal te /
analyzed: lus 'dis bdag ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal te /
translated: This body has taken me across the ocean of the lower realms.

original: 'dis lhar skye ba'i gnas yongs su bzung ngo zhes 'di ltar lus de la dga' ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'dis lhar skye ba'i gnas yongs su bzung ngo zhes 'di ltar lus de la dga' ba bskyed nas /
translated: It has taken me to the realms of rebirth as a god.’ In this way, they are delighted with that body.

original: bdag gis 'di la mchod pa legs par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la mchod pa legs par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will make offerings to it well.

original: phyis lus de gzings bzhin du bor nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: phyis lus de gzings bzhin du bor nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro'o //
translated: Later, having abandoned that body like a boat, I will go to the next world.

original: gang rang gi lus kyis bsod nams ma byas pa de'i rnam par shes pa de ni ji ltar skyes bu gzings rul bas mtsho chen po de'i nang du 'bying zhing zhig ste ma rungs par gyur nas /

translated: The consciousness of one who has not made merit with his own body is like a man whose rotten boat sinks in the great ocean.

original: skyes bu de yang nyam thag ste gzings zhig pa des 'jigs bzhin du 'gram du phyin nas kyang /
analyzed: skyes bu de yang nyam thag ste gzings zhig pa des 'jigs bzhin du 'gram du phyin nas kyang /
translated: That man, in despair, reaches the shore in fear of the sinking boat.🔽He arrives at a place where there are lions and tigers.

original: seng ge dang / stag yod pa'i 'jigs sar phyin par gyur nas de la 'di skad ces zer ro //
analyzed: seng ge dang / stag yod pa'i 'jigs sar phyin par gyur nas de la 'di skad ces zer ro //
translated: He says this:

original: gzings rul pas nyon mongs kyi steng du log par sod nas mtsho chen po'i chu rlabs kyis dkrugs pa /
analyzed: gzings rul pas nyon mongs kyi steng du log par sod nas mtsho chen po'i chu rlabs kyis dkrugs pa /
translated: “My rotten boat has been destroyed by the afflictions. I am tossed by the waves of the great ocean.🔽I am in danger of being bitten by snakes.”

original: sbrul gyis klongs par zhugs so zhes gzings de la de skad smra'o //
analyzed: sbrul gyis klongs par zhugs so zhes gzings de la de skad smra'o //
translated: He says this to the boat.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i 'di bsod nams ma yin pa byas pa'i lus la brten nas ngan song gi sar song nas lus de la 'di skad zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i 'di bsod nams ma yin pa byas pa'i lus la brten nas ngan song gi sar song nas lus de la 'di skad zer ro //
translated: In the same way, the consciousness that is based on the body of unwholesome actions goes to the lower realms. It says to the body:

original: sdig pa'i lus 'dis ci zhig rnyed na sdig pa can gyi lus mngon par grub nas bdag khur lta bus @467a *//
analyzed: sdig pa'i lus 'dis ci zhig rnyed na sdig pa can gyi lus mngon par grub nas bdag khur lta bus @467a *//
translated: “What have you gained by this unwholesome body? Having accomplished this unwholesome body, I am oppressed by a burden.

original: non par gyur /
analyzed: non par gyur /
translated: I am overwhelmed by this putrid body.

original: bdag lus rul pa 'di'i rgyus ngan song du mngon par phyogs shing zhugs te mchil bas nya zin pa bzhin no snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag lus rul pa 'di'i rgyus ngan song du mngon par phyogs shing zhugs te mchil bas nya zin pa bzhin no snyam mo //
translated: Because of this putrid body, I am heading towards the lower realms, like a fish caught on a hook.”

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa de legs par byas pa'i bsod nams kyis gzings bzang po bzhin du 'khor ba las rgal bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa de legs par byas pa'i bsod nams kyis gzings bzang po bzhin du 'khor ba las rgal bar byed do //
translated: In this way, consciousness, through wholesome merit, acts like a good ship, carrying one across saṃsāra.

original: bsod nams ma yin pas ni log par ltung par byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pas ni log par ltung par byed do //

original: drang srong chen po /
analyzed: drang srong chen po /

original: drang srong chen po /

translated: Great Sage,

analyzed: gang la srog gcod pa spangs nas dad cing dad pas sbyin pa sbyin zhing /

analyzed: nor bu dang / gser dang / dngul dang / rdo rje dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa rdzas thams @476a *//

analyzed: dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / sor gdub dang / se mo do dang / do shal sna tshogs kyis brgyan cing /

analyzed: de skyes pa'i tshe lha mo de lha la lta zhing gzhon nu skyes kyi /

analyzed: khyod dga' ba skyed cig / ces zer te /

original: pha ma de gnyis yid dga'o //

original: gzhon nu de zhag bdun 'das nas rna cha sna tshogs mgul ba 'phyang bar mngon par 'grub bo; ;de zhag bdun 'das nas 'di lta bu dran par 'gyur te /

analyzed: bdag che ge mo zhig nas 'dir 'ongs te /
